document_title: Urinary tract infection: Causes, symptoms, treatment
subsection_content:
When treated promptly and properly, urinary tract infections rarely lead to complications. On the contrary, in cases where treatment is ineffective or too late, this condition can cause serious consequences. Complications may include:
Recurrent infections, especially in women who have had the disease 2 or more times within a period of 6 - 12 months.; If left untreated, a UTI can cause acute or chronic kidney infection, causing permanent damage to the patient's kidneys.; Urinary tract infection during pregnancy is a medical condition that, if not treated properly, can cause dangerous complications such as pyelonephritis in the mother, risk of miscarriage, and premature birth; low birth weight babies, newborn infections...; Newborns may be underweight; Recurrent urethritis causes urethral stricture, especially in men; Sepsis and even death if the kidneys become inflamed
